com.googlecode.cqengine.index.sqlite

Class SQLiteIndex<A extends Comparable<A>,O,K>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.cqengine.index.support.AbstractAttributeIndex<A,O>
      • com.googlecode.cqengine.index.sqlite.SQLiteIndex<A,O,K>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModificationListener<O>, AttributeIndex<A,O>, Index<O>, KeyStatisticsIndex<A,O>, ResourceIndex, SortedKeyStatisticsAttributeIndex<A,O>, SortedKeyStatisticsIndex<A,O>

    public class SQLiteIndex<A extends Comparable<A>,O,K>
extends AbstractAttributeIndex<A,O>
implements SortedKeyStatisticsAttributeIndex<A,O>, ResourceIndex
    An index backed by a table in a SQLite database.

    This index is highly configurable, and forms the basis for other simpler indexes: SQLiteIdentityIndex, OffHeapIndex and DiskIndex.

    Specifically, this index allows details of the database to which data should be persisted, to be supplied by the application on-the-fly in request-scope via QueryOptions, as an alternative to configuring a particular database statically.

    This is useful in applications where CQEngine does not create/destroy or manage the life cycle of the database itself, and so where the application requires tight control over how the database is accessed.

    In applications where CQEngine manages the SQLite database, users should probably not use this index directly, but should use one of the simpler indexes mentioned above instead.

    Index implementation

    This index is persisted in a SQLite table with the following schema: 
     CREATE TABLE ${table_name} (
      objectKey ${objectKey_type},
      value ${value_type},
      PRIMARY KEY (objectKey, value)
 ) WITHOUT ROWID;

 CREATE INDEX idx_${table}_value ON ${table} (value);
    Where:
    • table_name is the name of the table. The name of the attribute (on which the index will be built) is used to name the table. A "cqtbl_" string will be prefixed and all the non alpha-numeric chars will be stripped out.
    • objectKey stores the value from the primaryKeyAttribute for each object stored (generic type K). If the primary key is configured as Car.CAR_ID then this column will hold the carId. The type of the primary key attribute will be converted to the corresponding database type.
    • value is the type of the indexed value (generic type A). If the index is built on an attribute Car.MODEL, then this will hold the car model string. The type of the attribute on which the index is built will be converted to the corresponding database type.
    • Note that this index supports MultiValueAttribute, which means there may be more than one value for each objecyKey.
    Author:
    Silvano Riz

      • SQLiteIndex

        public SQLiteIndex(Attribute<O,A> attribute,
           SimpleAttribute<O,K> primaryKeyAttribute,
           SimpleAttribute<K,O> foreignKeyAttribute,
           ConnectionManager connectionManager)
        Package-private constructor. The index should be created via the static factory methods instead.
        Parameters:
        attribute - The Attribute on which the index will be built.
        primaryKeyAttribute - The SimpleAttribute with which the index will retrieve the object key.
        foreignKeyAttribute - The SimpleAttribute to map a query result into the domain object.
        connectionManager - The ConnectionManager or null if it will be provided via QueryOptions.

      • retrieve

        public ResultSet<O> retrieve(Query<O> query,
                    QueryOptions queryOptions)
        Description copied from interface: Index
        Returns a ResultSet which when iterated will return objects from the index matching the query supplied.

        Usually ResultSets are lazy which means that they don't actually do any work, or encapsulate or materialize matching objects, but rather they encapsulate logic to fetch matching objects from the index on-the-fly as the application iterates through the ResultSet.

        Specified by:
        retrieve in interface Index<O>
        Parameters:
        query - An object which specifies some restriction on an attribute of an object
        queryOptions - Optional parameters for the query
        Returns:
        A set of objects with attributes matching the restriction imposed by the query
        See Also:
        Index.supportsQuery(com.googlecode.cqengine.query.Query)
